author: drkannobeck
title: Mental Health Dapp on the go
description: A mental health assistant app that stays with you on the go.

assessments.note: Has the potential to be a useful proposal that effectively addresses the challenge although I could not find any link to suitable clinician in the team.
agree with the problem statement. solution has nothing to do with it. this has nothing to do with cardano or dapps.

Advocating for mental health support systems is extremely important when it comes to bringing the best out in people. The decentralized nature of cardano I can see being used to connect individuals in new ways without feeling the pressure of being in a 'mental institute' sort of scenario.

Concept is really valid. Where I am struggling with is that the proposal does not really explain in good detail how it aligns with the goals of the community nor how the utility will be brought around. I read the attached slide deck as well - but I am not really understanding the decentralized app angle entirely. It would have helped me greatly if more attention was spent on that point so it would eliminate doubts of how it plans to be implemented on a technical level.
It proposed a good idea and a solution that is urgently needed in the users community. However, overall speaking it didn't state how this proposal can make an impact to the Cardano ecosystem.
The team appears to have experience in designing applications but my primary concern would be clinical guidance on the structure/best practice.
irrelevant experience. highly likely will have zero output.

It appears this is a single developer from what I can tell. Possible to accomplish this app as an individual but may want to consider hiring additional people and making the project open source but there isn't mention of this. The features of the app seem very possible to create, along with the way to bring in therapists and users

I recognize some members of the community in the co-proposer section and in the slide deck. However, it would have helped to understand how the concept of Nigeria is tied with the proposers. Is one of them from there, living there? Understands the medical environment of the country, etc. I couldn't determine that. Perhaps part of it can be attributed due to no external references/links to professional profiles - like linked in or past work projects. That would really help eliminate these issues very clearly. But that is the lesser of my issues. What raises another question - there is no actual budget breakdown or any financial heading. It states one grand figure but we don't have any sense of why this amount and what we can expect it to achieve once broken down into different buckets.
Relevant experience stated in the proposal can only satisfy the setting up of the app. However, a successful app also needs to have great marketing effort which the proposal didn't mention.
My concern is the information provided is Dapp relevant rather than mental health relevant. The addition of a team of clinical advisors crucial for this proposal to go forward.

There are quite a decent amount of detail on what sort of features the app will have and that gives me the impression that the developer has put a good amount of thought into how it will work and that it can work. Best of luck!

There is a nice roadmap graphic in the slide deck. That also brings about some key milestones. I noticed that your last one says you will celebrate after launch. Unfortunately, I couldn't grasp what a success story looks like. Prior celebration - we would need to establish what success metrics to track, which KPIs to consider. Absent of these - I am not sure how we can determine validity of investment just yet. It helps narrow down the focus for you as a proposer but also us as a community. While there is pretty good identification of problem and proposed solution - I would have loved to learn more about challenges/risks that authors are thinking about implementation of the proposed solution. Adding all of these elements would have greatly elevated the proposal. So I think it has some legs - but needs more attention to it.

FYI - quick feedback on the attached presentation - customer pain points slide needs to be adjusted as it is difficult to separate the text in between - just a formatting issue. So helps to 'proof read' the proposal before submission. Thank you for putting it together - made it easier to navigate the thought process behind this project.
It explained the functionality of the app but it didn't explain how the app can be promoted to secure large base of users.

solution: Mental health is one of the most overlooked aspects of most of our lives that we forget to check up on ourselves, our mental well-being.
